verses.verse: (Confident Plea for Deliverance from Enemies) To the leader: with stringed instruments. A Psalm of David. (Ps 17.6; 18.6, 18; 24.5; 27.7) Answer me when I call, O God of my right! You gave me room when I was in distress. Be gracious to me, and hear my prayer.
(Ps 31.6, 18) How long, you people, shall my honor suffer shame? How long will you love vain words and seek after lies? Selah
(Ps 6.8, 9; 31.23) But know that the LORD has set apart the faithful for himself; the LORD hears when I call to him.
(Ps 33.8; 77.6; Eph 4.26) When you are disturbed, (Or are angry) do not sin; ponder it on your beds, and be silent. Selah
(Deut 33.19; Ps 37.3; 50.14) Offer right sacrifices, and put your trust in the LORD.
(Num 6.26) There are many who say, “O that we might see some good! Let the light of your face shine on us, O LORD!”
(Isa 9.3; Acts 14.17) You have put gladness in my heart more than when their grain and wine abound.
(Lev 25.18; Ps 3.5) I will both lie down and sleep in peace, for you alone, O LORD, make me lie down in safety.
